title: Why Senna and Prost were held back by 'strange fear' of each other
summary: Ayrton Senna and Alain Prost were more concerned about losing ground to the other than taking a risk to maximise their own performance, says McLaren designer Neil Oatley in a newMotor Sportinterview

qa_pairs.question: Which two legendary Formula 1 drivers had a famous rivalry during the late 1980s and early 1990s?
What team were Ayrton Senna and Alain Prost driving for during their intense rivalry?
What psychological factor reportedly affected Senna and Prost's performance against each other?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: 'Strange fear' of losing to one another
